rename.from: Feature request: Add Backbalze B2 as storage backend
rename.to: Feature request: Add Backblaze B2 as storage backend

body: Good idea! I've been  on the waitlist for some time now - just waiting for my invite.

Even better, please also add their "consumer" product, "Backblaze Unlimited Backup". That would make a great alternative/competition for Amazon Cloud Storage (currently 20% cheaper on a 2-year basis).
@durval-menezes I don't think there is a public API for that is there?

They don't provide one and I think reverse engineering is not the best idea in this case.  
Got an invite already and am playing around a bit, implementing another backend for B2 should be pretty straight forward. However they for example "only" feature a SHA1 hash and not a MD5 one, so syncing would need some more effort to work.

I have made a prototype for a b2 backend.  There are several problems with it though, the major one being that to upload files we need to know the sha1 in advance.  I've worked around this by copying the data into a tempfile but it isn't optimal.

I'm having a problem uploading certain file names too for reasons I haven't figured out yet - I suspect a bug in B2...

When it working slightly better I'll put a beta out for you to try.

@ncw I recently cloned the project to add B2 support as well. I'm glad to see you already got something working. I'd like to help if possible, I received access to it and would like to use it with `rsync`. Thanks for providing this great tool and Go lang code!

The beta is ready! Should be fully functional.  Let me know!

http://pub.rclone.org/v1.25-20-g42c3005%CE%B2/
I just remembered I forgot to put the directory listing paging in, so it will be limited to 1000 objects in a bucket - fix coming soon!
Dude, awesome! I'll test it when you make it available. Thanks again for working on it.
And I'm guessing that the branch is still unavailable. @ncw Are you going to merge it into master soon, or...?
@cbess you can download a binary from the link above http://pub.rclone.org/v1.25-20-g42c3005%CE%B2/ - I'll merge to master after a bit of feedback so please test!

I've tested it on a couple simple text files, its working as expected. I'm using **rclone-v1.25-20-g42c3005Î²-linux-386.zip**. I've tested `config`, `ls`, `lsd`, `sync` and `copy`. I'm going to throw a couple thousand files at it soon, hopefully over the weekend. I'll let you know what happens.

I appreciate the comments on the func signatures. @ncw I have a small request, please throw some extra comments in there to help me learn some more about how to add _other_ backend support, namely the connection/auth portions.
Here is a new beta with the 1000 file limit fixed: http://pub.rclone.org/v1.25-21-gfd120b3%CE%B2/
@cbess Thanks for testing. I don't know if you saw the CONTRIBUTING.md file I put up today which has a section on how to write a new backend.  Not a lot of stuff on auth though!
No prob. Nice, I didn't see it, but I'm check it out now. I added a link in the `readme` to maybe prevent others from missing it as well. See #267.
